intro: Atheropogon hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy panicgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the Americas. It typically grows in wetland and marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Atheropogon hirsutus plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
